contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=October 2009}} '''Volksmarching''' (from German ''{{Lang|de|Volksmarsch}}'' meaning "peoples' march") is a form of non-competitive fitness walking that developed in Europe. Participants typically walk {{convert|10|km|mi|sp=us}} on an outdoor path. Volksmarching associations offer incentive awards (usually pins and patches) for collecting a certain number of events. Volksmarching participants enjoy recording distances and event participation in international record books. Less frequently used terms are ''{{Lang|de|Volkswanderung}}'' and ''Volkswalk''. ==External links== * [http://www.ava.org/index.htm American Volkssport Association] * [http://www.ivv-web.org/ Internationaler Volkssportverband â€“ IVV (International Federation of Popular Sports)] * [http://www.walks.ca/CVF/Home.html The Canadian Volkssport Federation (CVF)] * [http://www.bwf-ivv.org.uk/ British Walking Association] * [http://www.dvv-wandern.de/ German Volkssportverband] {{Germany-stub}} [[Category:German society]] [[Category:Walking]] [[Category:Hiking]]
